p: Different HAdV species display various tissue tropisms that correlate with the different clinical symptoms of infection [ 14]. HAdV species A has often been associated with the gastrointestinal tract, whereas species B (HAdV-3, 7, 14, and 55), C (HAdV-1, 2, 5, and 6), and E (HAdV-4) are known to cause respiratory tract infections. Species D (HAdV-8, 19, and 37) commonly causes adenoviral kerato-conjunctivitis. Species F variants, including HAdV-F40 and-F41, and species G variant HAdV-G52 are mainly associated with gastrointestinal tract infections [ 2].
